name: Modern Languages (French, Spanish, German)
feeDetails: Contact the University of Herts for details.
aboutCourse:
Schools within our consortium expect applicants to be able to offer two languages, from a choice of French, Spanish and German, in order to be offered a place to train as a Modern Foreign Languages teacher.
Trainees spend 4 days a week in school and 1 day a week at University.
howSchoolPlacementsWork: Trainees will be based at their Host School for most of the year, undertaking a second 6 week placement, usually in the Spring Term. Teaching is likely to encompass all age ranges from 11-18.
